content.1: Woe unto them that decree unrighteous decrees, and that write grievousness
content.2: To turn aside the needy from judgment, and to take away the right from the poor of my people, that widows may be their prey, and
content.3: And what will ye do in the day of visitation, and in the desolation
content.4: Without me they shall bow down under the prisoners, and they shall fall under the slain. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand
content.5: O Assyrian, the rod of mine anger, and the staff in their hand is mine indignation.
content.6: I will send him against an hypocritical nation, and against the people of my wrath will I give him a charge, to take the spoil, and to take the prey, and to tread them down like the mire of the streets.
content.7: Howbeit he meaneth not so, neither doth his heart think so; but
content.10: As my hand hath found the kingdoms of the idols, and whose graven images did excel them of Jerusalem and of Samaria;
content.11: Shall I not, as I have done unto Samaria and her idols, so do to Jerusalem and her idols?
content.12: Wherefore it shall come to pass,
content.13: For he saith, By the strength of my hand I have done
content.14: And my hand hath found as a nest the riches of the people: and as one gathereth eggs
content.15: Shall the axe boast itself against him that heweth therewith?
content.16: Therefore shall the Lord, the Lord of hosts, send among his fat ones leanness; and under his glory he shall kindle a burning like the burning of a fire.
content.17: And the light of Israel shall be for a fire, and his Holy One for a flame: and it shall burn and devour his thorns and his briers in one day;
content.18: And shall consume the glory of his forest, and of his fruitful field, both soul and body: and they shall be as when a standardbearer fainteth.
content.19: And the rest of the trees of his forest shall be few, that a child may write them.
content.20: And it shall come to pass in that day,
content.22: For though thy people Israel be as the sand of the sea,
content.25: For yet a very little while, and the indignation shall cease, and mine anger in their destruction.
content.27: And it shall come to pass in that day,
content.28: He is come to Aiath, he is passed to Migron; at Michmash he hath laid up his carriages:
content.29: They are gone over the passage: they have taken up their lodging at Geba; Ramah is afraid; Gibeah of Saul is fled.
content.30: Lift up thy voice, O daughter of Gallim: cause it to be heard unto Laish, O poor Anathoth.
content.31: Madmenah is removed; the inhabitants of Gebim gather themselves to flee.
content.32: As yet shall he remain at Nob that day: he shall shake his hand
content.34: And he shall cut down the thickets of the forest with iron, and Lebanon shall fall by a mighty one.
